H0.text: Cell wall is the cellular structure that the student described as being present in animal cells, present in plant cells, and helping make energy available to the cell.

H1.text: Chloroplast is a cellular organelle that is present in animal cells, present in plant cells, and helps make energy available to the cell.

H2.text: Mitochondrion is present in both animal and plant cells and helps make energy available to the cell.

H3.text: Nucleus is present in both animal and plant cells and helps make energy available to the cell.

A4.text: Mitochondria have a double membrane structure and use aerobic respiration to generate adenosine triphosphate (ATP), which is used throughout the cell as a source of chemical energy.

A5.text: The matrix is important in the production of ATP with the aid of the ATP synthase contained in the inner membrane.
